text:
Linux: CentOS4.7
Java: j2sdk 1.4.2.19 (i586)

Rasterizer rendering image(in attach) from svg-file:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.1//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/1.1/DTD/svg11.dtd">
<svg width="1000" height="800"  xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" version="1.1">
<g filter="url(#textBlockFilter)">
<polygon points="641,196 730,230 666,196"  fill="url(#triangleGradient1)" />
<polygon points="746,196 731,230 756,196"  fill="url(#triangleGradient2)" />
<rect x="641" y="141" width="115" height="55"  rx="1"  fill="#F7F4DD" />
</g>
<g filter="url(#textBlockFilter)">
<polygon points="200,255 111,289 225,255"  fill="url(#triangleGradient3)" />
<rect x="200" y="200" width="115" height="55"  rx="1"  fill="#F7F4DD" />
</g>
<defs>
<filter id="textBlockFilter">
<feGaussianBlur in="SourceAlpha" result="text_block_blur" stdDeviation="2" />
<feOffset in="text_block_blur" result="text_block_blur_offset" dx="1" dy="1" />
<feComposite in="SourceGraphic" in2="text_block_blur_offset" operator="over" />
</filter>
<linearGradient id="triangleGradient1" x1="0.14044943820225" y1="0" x2="1" y2="1"><stop offset="15%" style="stop-color:#F7F4DD; stop-opacity:1" /><stop offset="50%" style="stop-color:#F3E89A; stop-opacity:1" /></linearGradient>
<linearGradient id="triangleGradient2" x1="0.8" y1="0" x2="0" y2="1"><stop offset="15%" style="stop-color:#F7F4DD; stop-opacity:1" /><stop offset="50%" style="stop-color:#F3E89A; stop-opacity:1" /></linearGradient>
<linearGradient id="triangleGradient3" x1="0.89035087719298" y1="0" x2="0" y2="1"><stop offset="15%" style="stop-color:#F7F4DD; stop-opacity:1" /><stop offset="50%" style="stop-color:#F3E89A; stop-opacity:1" /></linearGradient>
</defs>
</svg>
creator: xadminx@mail.ru
info@dvholten.de
text:
please provide command line for rasterizer - quick check with squiggle doesnt show the problem
thanks

Created attachment 23279
rasterized result obtained with 1.8pre (revision 745535) and JDK 1.6.0_12
creator: helder.magalhaes@gmail.com

text:
My guess is that this was being caused by issues in the Java 2D renderer itself. Please take a look at the discussion in bug 43411 [1] for a tightly related issue.

I wasn't able to reproduce neither using the provided command line nor using Squiggle. As stated in the attachment [2] description, I tested using Batik 1.8pre (revision 745535) and JDK 1.6.0_12.

I'm convinced that the fact that it doesn't reproduce has nothing to do with Batik, therefore I'm marking this "works for me" until proved otherwise. Please reopen if you feel like this should receive further attention. ;-)

Best regards,
 Helder

[1] https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=43411
[2] https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=23279
creator: helder.magalhaes@gmail.com
